meanings.definition: To clean (something) by rubbing its surface hard with a brush or cloth.
meanings.sent1: She scrubbed the floor until it sparkled.
meanings.sent2: I scrubbed the dishes after dinner.
meanings.sent3: He scrubbed the car so well, it looked brand new.
meanings.sent4: The hardworking cleaner scrubbed away all the dirt and grime.
meanings.sent5: The determined maid scrubbed tirelessly to make everything spotless.

meanings.definition: To cancel or abandon (a mission, plan, etc.).
meanings.sent1: The team scrubbed the mission due to bad weather.
meanings.sent2: They scrubbed the project because of budget constraints.
meanings.sent3: The astronaut scrubbed the spacewalk and decided to stay inside.
meanings.sent4: The captain scrubbed the voyage to ensure everyone's safety.
meanings.sent5: The teacher scrubbed the field trip, much to the disappointment of the students.

meanings.definition: Having been cleaned by rubbing its surface hard with a brush or cloth.
meanings.sent1: The scrubbed kitchen counter gleamed in the sunlight.
meanings.sent2: The scrubbed bathtub looked brand new after the cleaning.
meanings.sent3: The scrubbed windows allowed the sunlight to brighten the room.
meanings.sent4: The scrubbed floors felt smooth under bare feet.
meanings.sent5: The scrubbed dishes were stacked neatly in the cupboard.
